The 4 Characteristics of Efficient Sales Teams
Children's Flight of Hope - Krishnan Family

Owned by American entrepreneur and philanthropist Bob Parsons, BIG YAM is an advertising agency made up of some of the brightest, smartest and boldest talent in the industry. BIG YAM is driven by a passion to produce measurable results that 'ring the register' for our clients by providing a full range of marketing solutions including traditional and digital advertising, social media and public relations.

Responsible for strategic planning and development, and of overall leadership for the Public Relations department, including development of media relations and crisis communication plans for clients including Arizona Commission for PostSecondary Education, Estrella by Newland Communities and Superstition Mountain Golf and Country Club.

Responsible for planning and coordinating activities including public relations outreach, local and national media relations, and employee communications statewide. Acted as primary writer for public and employee communications, including press releases, social media postings, and newsletter articles and company-wide Intranet stories. Represented TWC throughout the community and identified and worked with nonprofit organizations and the corporate communications team to advance Connect a Million Minds, TWC’s multi-million dollar philanthropic initiative.

As PR Coordinator I acted as PR Counsel for clients, including the planning and development of the ongoing public relations/marketing program. I worked daily to coordinate the public relations team, set priorities, made assignments, and ensured completion of assignments. I worked to discover story angles while creating long-term relationships with press that could translate into valuable coverage. I also acted as lead on social media programs for clients. In a two-week period, one client realized an increase in fans on Facebook from 35 to over one-thousand.

I supervised a staff of reporters, photographers, and producers as a member of management. I planned and produced live special events, including hurricane coverage, on-location broadcasts, local and statewide political debates and sports specials. I also contributed to creative development of all news programming and collaborated with the News Director and Assistant News Director in daily newsroom operations.

Diane was my "work soul-mate". You go to school, you get done, begin looking for a job. All the while you're hoping that one day you can work with great thinkers and people who challenge you and provide you opportunities to rise to the occasion. Diane was that person at LHWH. Invaluable for her insight and teamwork, she made it seem easy.  Always thinking about better ways to do something, or an approach that you hadn't thought of yet, she was the definition of "A-game". She has an infectious enthusiasm that she brings to the job that's only matched by her skills and intelligence. A tenacious go-getter who's one of those people you give something to knowing that it's going to get done and it's going to get done right.

June 11, 2010, Diane worked with Jeff in different groups

Jeff is one of the most creative and talented people I have ever worked with. He came to work every day with ideas, and more importantly, ways to implement those ideas. His enthusiasm for his work was equally matched by his talent. Always looking for ways to learn more, he passed his vast knowledge on to the entire company with a series of "classes" he taught. He always made the most intimidating subject seem manageable and easy to understand. The perfect work teammate at LHWH, I could always go to him for ideas and inspiration. Jeff is truly at the top of his game and one of the most driven people I know. You never have to worry about a project he is working on. He makes sure that things not only get done, but goes above and beyond to make sure they're done right.

summary: With more than 15 years of media and communications experience, I bring a forward-thinking attitude to my communications approach. My extensive background in news has helped to create and maintain media contacts across the country. I oversee all public relations accounts at BIG YAM, The Parsons Agency.  Specialties: Public relations, communications, strategic thinking, media relationships, crisis communications, writing and editing and social media
name: Diane (Snow) Smith
title: Director of Public Relations at BIG YAM, The Parsons Agency
